history.content: If you have a good working ethics you probably will be fine grade-wise, but there's really no need to squeeze these three giants into one semester. Maybe just 127+189, they are a good combo for the spring semester.

If you have a good working ethics you probably will be fine grade-wise, but there's really no need to squeeze these three giants into one semester. Maybe just 127+189, they are a good combo for the spring semester.

====================================

I did them along with cs170. I'd say as soon as you are taking them in spring and put a lot of work you will be fine workload wise. However, I don't think it's worthwhile to take 126 again after one of stat 134 & 140. That's too much overlapping.

If you have a good working ethics you probably will be fine grade-wise, but there's really no need to squeeze these three giants into one semester. Maybe just 127+189, they are a good combo for the spring semester.

====================================

I did them along with cs170. I'd say as soon as you are taking them in spring you will be fine.

If you have a good working ethics you probably will be fine grade-wise, but there's really no need to squeeze these three giants into one semester. Maybe just 127+189, they are a good combo for the spring semester.

I'm thinking of doing this next semester. I won't have many time commitments outside of these classes. I realize this is a very difficult schedule, but my past performance grade-wise leads me to believe I can handle it. I've also taken one of {stat 134, 140}, so a lot of the material in 126 won't be totally new to me. (150 would probably be a better fit material-wise, but I think 126 is a much better-taught class, and I've heard great things about ramchandran.)

I'm curious about the workload. I've looked through 126 homeworks and they look to be around the same length as 170/70 homeworks, though I'm guessing they're a good bit harder. I've generally been able to finish 70/170 homework in ~5-6 hours, so would 10 hours be a reasonable estimate? Can I expect 127 to take less time than that? And what is 189's workload like with shewchuck relative to 170 or the lowerdivs?
history.subject: Has anyone taken 126, 127, and 189 together?
